definition: to send sb abroad at the government's expense

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie

sentences.english: Those studying abroad at public expense shall have an obligation to return to and serve the country after succeeding in their studies.
sentences.chinese: 公派在外学习人员有义务在学成之后回国服务。

sentences.english: Were you sponsored by the government or self-supported?
sentences.chinese: 你是由国家公派的还是自费留学？

sentences.english: Wenwen emphasized that Wine had been sent to study wine in France for the specialized study of making wine.
sentences.chinese: 文文说她听说Wine已公派到法国学习酿造技术了。

definition: to major (in a field)/to study a specialty to obtain a higher degree
to join the faculty of one's alma mater upon graduation/to remain at school during vacation
to seek knowledge/to study/to attend college
to become naturalized/to become a citizen
to pass an entrance exam/to be admitted to
to recommend sb for postgraduate studies/to admit for postgraduate studies without taking the entrance exam
